text: Laryngeal consonants are consonants that are articulated (made) in the larynx. Laryngeal consonants include pharyngeal consonants, glottal consonants,John Esling (2010) "Phonetic Notation", in Hardcastle, Laver & Gibbon (eds) The Handbook of Phonetic Sciences, 2nd ed.Note that Esling (2010) has abandoned epiglotto-pharyngeal as a distinct articulation. and for some languages uvular consonants.Scott Moisik, Ewa Czaykowska-Higgins, & John H. Esling (2012) "The Epilaryngeal Articulator: A New Conceptual Tool for Understanding Lingual- Laryngeal Contrasts" == References == Category:Consonants
title: Laryngeal consonant
